member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceiveMessageDataHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a deserialized OSC message from the corresponding OSC Link event.
member.param: Received OSC message, deserialized.
The IP end point from which the message was received.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceiveBundlesDataHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a batch of deserialized OSC bundles (consisting of deserialized OSC messages) from the corresponding OSC Link event.
member.param: A batch of received OSC bundles, deserialized.
The IP end point from which the bundles were received.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceivePacketBinaryHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a serialized OSC packet (in its binary form) from a corresponding OSC Link event.
member.param: Received serialized OSC packet.
The IP end point from which the packet was received.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnSendMessageHandler
member.summary: Used to get copies of OSC messages sent by OSC Link, in their deserialized form (for debugging and logging, for example)
member.param: Sent OSC message, deserialized.
The IP end point to which the message was sent.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnSendBundlesHandler
member.summary: Used to get copies of OSC bundles sent by OSC Link, in their deserialized form (for debugging and logging, for example)
member.param: Sent OSC bundles, deserialized.
The IP end point to which the message was sent.

member.name: T:OscLib.LinkMode
member.summary: Designates the OSC Link's current mode of operation.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.Closed
member.summary: OSC Link is closed and not in operation.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.ToTarget
member.summary: OSC Link is open and connected to a specific end point, discarding all other communications, only being able to send packets to that end point.

member.name: F:OscLib.LinkMode.Wide
member.summary: OSC Link is open to any end point, and can send packets to any end point it damn well pleases.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscLink
member.summary:
Used to send and receive OSC messages over UDP. Can operate in two modes: targeted to one specific endpoint, or wide-open free-for-all.
To Do: Add TCP support.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscLink._name
member.summary: This OSC Link's name.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.Open

member.summary: Opens a link to specific target address and port (only sending and receiving messages from that target), using random available port.

Thrown when OSC Link is already open.

The OSC Link will only communicate with this IP end point.

Couldn't open a socket with the provided port number.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscReceiver
member.summary:
Implements an OSC Address Space, associating C# method delegates with OSC Methods. Processes messages and bundles coming from the attached OSC Link, pattern matching if needed.
To Do: implement a buffer and delay system to properly adhere to incoming bundles' timestamps. Currently all bundles will be processed as they come.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver.RootContainerName
member.summary: The default name of the root container.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscReceiver._root
member.summary: The root container, from which all the larger OSC Address Space stems.

member.summary: Controls the access to the OSC Address Space.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscReceiver.Root
member.summary: The root container, from which all the larger OSC Address Space stems.

member.summary: Creates a new OSC Receiver, connecting it to an OSC Link.

member.exception: Thrown if provided OSC Link is null.

member.summary: Processes an incoming batch of bundles. Invoked when the connected OSC Link receives bundles.

The IP end point from which the bundles were received.

The IP end point from which the message was received.

member.summary: Adds an OSC Method to the specified address in the OSC Address Space.
member.param: The address of this OSC Method. Shouldn't contain any reserved symbols except for separators. The last part of the pattern is used as the method's name.
The method delegate that will be attached to the OSC Method, to be invoked when the method is triggered by an OSC message.
member.exception: Thrown when the address pattern is invalid.

member.summary: Adds an OSC Container to the specified address in the OSC Address Space.

member.exception: Thrown when the address pattern is invalid.

member.returns: True if packet should be sent, False otherwise.

member.summary: Checks whether the packet needs to be removed from the packet heap for whatever reason, precluding it from ever being sent.
member.param: Packet to be checked for removal.
member.returns: True if packet should be removed, False otherwise.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSender`1
member.summary: Implements a multi-priority sender queue to work with an OSC Link, for message bundling and orderly sending. OSC Link needs to be in targeted mode when operating.
member.typeparam: The particular type of the OSC binary packet used with this Sender. Should implement the IOscPacketBinary interface.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._oscLink
member.summary: OSC Link in use with this Sender. Needs to be in targeted mode.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeapPriorityLayersTotal
member.summary: The total amount of priority levels in this Sender's packet heap.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._cycleLengthMs
member.summary: The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Shoudln't be less than 1.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._bundlePacketsBeforeSending
member.summary: Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._isActive
member.summary: Whether this Sender is currently active.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeap
member.summary: The packet heap, holding all the packets before they are processed and sent (or not). Implements several priority levels.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetHeapAccessMutex
member.summary: Used to facilitate orderly access to the packet heap.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._cycleBinaryDataHolder

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._packetMaxLength
member.summary: Maximum amount of data sent per packet, in bytes. As per UDP spec, sending more than 508 bytes per packet is not advisable.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscSender`1._processPacketHeapTask
member.summary: The Task that performs the packet heap checks and manages it, sending the packets out when necessary.

member.summary: Checks whether the packet should be sent in the current cycle.

member.summary: Checks whether the packet should be removed in the current cycle.

member.summary: Whether this Sender is currently active.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.ProcessPacketHeapTaskStatus
member.summary: Shows the current status of the task processing the packet heap.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.BundlePacketsBeforeSending
member.summary: Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.CycleLengthMs
member.summary: The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Minimum 1 ms.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.PacketMaxLength
member.summary: Controls the maximum allowed length for outgoing OSC data packets. Minimum 128 bytes.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Sender.
member.param: Maximum amount of data sent per packet, in bytes. As per UDP spec, sending more than 508 bytes per packet is not advisable.
The length of the heap check cycle of this Sender - that is, the time between heap checks, in milliseconds. Shoudln't be less than 1.
The total amount of priority levels in this Sender's packet heap.
Should this Sender bundle the packets before sending, or just send them as separate messages as they come.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.Activate(OscLib.OscLink)
member.summary: Activates the Sender and connects it to an OSC Link.
member.param: The OSC Link this Sender will be sending packets through.
member.exception: Is thrown when the provided OSC Link is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the sender, cancelling the heap processing task and disattaching the sender from the OSC Link.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetPacketReadyCheckerMethod(OscLib.PacketReadyChecker{`0})
member.summary: Provides the method delegate for checking if a packet is eligible to be sent.
member.param: The method to be used for checking packets.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetPacketRemoverMethod(OscLib.PacketRemover{`0})
member.summary: Provides the method delegate for checking if a packet needs to be removed from the heap.
member.param: The method to be used for removing packets.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SendOscPacket(`0@)
member.summary: Gets the binary data from the OSC packet and immediately sends it through the OSC Link as a message.
member.param: A reference to the OSC binary data packet to be sent.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to send data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapHead(`0@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Inserts the packet to the beginning of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the packet by reference.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be last in line.
Also, this method is slower than adding to heap tail.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapHead(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Inserts the packet to the beginning of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the packet directly.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be last in line.
Also, this method is slower than adding to heap tail.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapTail(`0@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds the OSC packet to the end of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the OSC packet by reference.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be first in line.
This method is faster than adding to heap head.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapTail(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds the OSC packet to the end of the heap at the specified priority level, passing the packet directly.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be first in line.
This method is faster than adding to heap head.
member.param: The OSC binary data packet.
The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.ProcessHeapLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes one level of data heap and sends either bundles or messages according to the setting.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns an overview of the packet heap, showing the number of packets per priority level.

member.summary: Packet length in bytes.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscBundle
member.summary: Represents a deserialized OSC message bundle. In a slight deviation from the spec, this struct CANNOT contain other bundles.
member.remarks: the idea behind this is that when deserializing incoming bundles, the bundles contained within other bundles are extracted (should their timestamps not be less than that of the enveloping bundle). They are then dealt with according to their timestamps and the configuration of the OscReceiver. The reason for it working the way it works is to 1) have both messages and bundles represented as structs, and 2) avoid using interfaces. All to do with boxing/unboxing and avoiding the dreaded gc pressure as much as possible.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscBundle.HeaderLength
member.summary: The length of the bundle header in bytes. That is, the "#bundle " + [timestamp] bit.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Timestamp
member.summary: Timestamp attached to this bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Messages
member.summary: Messages inside this bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Length
member.summary: Length of this bundle in bytes.

An array of OSC messages to be contained within this bundle.

member.summary: Indexer access to the elements of this container, using their indices.
member.param: Index of the element.
member.returns: The element under the provided index.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.#ctor(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.AddPart(OscLib.OscAddressPart)
member.summary: Adds an OSC container or a method to this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.RemovePart(OscLib.OscAddressPart)
member.summary: Removes an OSC container or a method from this container, if it's inside this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.RemovePart(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Removes an OSC container or a method with a specified name from this container, if it's inside this container.
member.exception: Thrown when an element with the provided name is not present inside this container.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscContainer.ContainsPart(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Checks if container contains an address part with a provided name (or adhering to a provided pattern).

member.name: T:OscLib.OscMethod
member.summary: Represents an OSC Method, to be used with the OSC Address Space - that is called when an appropriate OSC message is received.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscMethod.DelegateName
member.summary: The name of the attached method delegate.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMethod.#ctor(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscMethodDelegate)
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Method and links it with the provided delegate.
member.param: The name of the OSC Method. This will be used to invoke it when receiving messages.
The delegate pointing to a method that should be invoked with this OSC Method.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided delegate method is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscMethod.Invoke(System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the attached method delegate.
member.param: An array of arguments to pass to the delegate.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscMethodDelegate
member.summary: Used in conjunction with the OSC address system to assign actual methods to OSC Methods.
member.param: Arguments to be passed from the received OSC Message to the method when invoked.

member.summary: Separates parts of address string. Always should present at the start of an address string.

member.summary: Designates the beginning of an OSC type tag string, separates substrings in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.SymbolSpace
member.summary: Personal space.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.SymbolAsterisk
member.summary: A wildcard symbol in pattern matching.

member.summary: An "any symbol" symbol in pattern matching.

member.summary: A reversal symbol in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.SymbolDash

member.summary: Square brackets used in pattern matching.

member.summary: Curly brackets used in pattern matching.

member.summary: Curly brackets used in pattern matching.

member.summary: The byte values for the "#bundle " string that designates an OSC bundle (duh). Pls don't change elements, thx.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscProtocol.AddressStringSpecialSymbols
member.summary: Reserved symbols that shouldn't be used in OSC Method or Container names - just to have all of them in a nice and tidy array. Pls don't change elements, thx.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscProtocol.LocalIP
member.summary: Local IP address.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscString
member.summary: Contains an ASCII string recorded as an array of bytes - to avoid dealing with actual strings. Can be accessed via an indexer.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.OscLength
member.summary: The length of this string in bytes when used as an OSC argument or address.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.Length
member.summary: The length of this string in bytes.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.Chars
member.summary: Returns a copy of an array containing all chars (their byte representations, that is) that constitute this string.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.OscBytes
member.summary: Returns a copy of an array containing all chars (their byte representations, that is) that is of the right length to be used as an element in OSC binary packet.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.ContainsReservedSymbols
member.summary: Whether this string contains special symbols reserved by OSC protocol.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscString.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer access to get the chars, as ASCII bytes.
member.param: Index of the char.

member.summary: Creates an OSC string out of a byte array.

member.summary: Creates an OSC string out of a part of a byte array.

The start index.
The length of the string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an OSC string out of a plain old string.
member.param: The source plain old string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ScrubReservedSymbols
member.summary: Removes any symbols from the string that are reserved by the OSC protocol, swapping them with "_", and returns the resulting string

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ScrubReservedSymbols(System.String)
member.summary: Removes any symbols from the string that are reserved by the OSC protocol, swapping them with "_", and returns the resulting string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.CopyTo(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of this string's byte array into the specified one-dimentional byte array, starting from the index provided.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.Split(System.Byte)
member.summary: Splits the OSC string into an array of new OSC string, using the provided symbol.

member.returns: An array of resulting OSC strings.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetSubstring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a substring from this string.
member.param: The index at which the substring starts.
The length of the substring.
member.exception: Thrown when "start" is beyond the string's length, or when "length" is too large.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.PatternMatch(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Compares this string to a pattern, returns whether they match or not.
member.param: The pattern to which the string is compared.
member.returns: True if string matches the pattern, false if not (duh).
member.exception: Thrown when either the curly brackets or the square brackets aren't closed in the pattern.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the OSC string as an actual string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the OSC string to an object.
member.param: Object to compare to.
member.returns: Whether the OSC string is equal to object.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code of the OSC string, so it can be used as a key in dictionaries, for example.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Equality(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Allows to compare OSC strings to each other.
member.param: First string.
Second string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscString.op_Inequality(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Allows to compare OSC strings to each other.
member.param: First string.
Second string.

member.summary: Allows to implicitly convert strings to OscStrings.

member.summary: Allows to explicitly convert OscStrings to strings.

member.remarks: The method is generic to avoid the struct-as-interface boxing/unboxing shenanigans.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSerializer
member.summary: Translates OSC messages and bundles into binary packets, serializing it to be sent over the network.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.MessageToBinary(OscLib.OscString,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data using the provided address string and arguments.
member.param: The address string (can be a full address or a pattern)
The arguments (should be of supported types, obviously)
member.returns: An OSC-compliant binary packet containing the message.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(OscLib.OscPacketBinary[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data that is a bundle, containing all provided packets, timestamped for immediate execution on receipt.
member.param: OSC binary packets to be bundled up.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(OscLib.OscTimestamp,OscLib.OscPacketBinary[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data that is a bundle, containing all provided packets, using the provided timestamp.
member.param: The timestamp to stamp the bundle with.
OSC binary packets to be bundled up.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Packs the preformatted binary data into an OSC packet and adds the right header. Make sure the data *is* OSC-compliant, that is, use at your own risk.
member.param: The preformatted, OSC-compliant binary data, hopefully.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscTime
member.summary: Manages timing and timestamps. Provides a session tick for ease of timekeeping.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.SessionTick
member.summary: Provides the number of ticks elapsed since the first call for this class.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.GlobalTick
member.summary: Provides the current "global" UTC tick.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.Immediately
member.summary: Provides the OSC-compliant "DO IT. DO IT NOW." timestamp.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.ImmediatelyBytes
member.summary: Provides a "pre-rendered" byte representation of the OSC-compliant "DO IT NOW" timestamp.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.Now
member.summary: Provides an OSC timestamp representing the current time (as far as the system is aware).

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.NtpEpochStart
member.summary: The start of the current NTP epoch - 00:00 01/01/1900 at the moment.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTime.AfterSeconds(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns an OSC timestamp that occurs after the provided number of seconds has passed.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscTimestamp
member.summary: Contains a timestamp in ways understandable both by OSC (NTP-style) and C# (DateTime ticks)

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.NtpTimestamp
member.summary: This timestamp represented in NTP format.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.Ticks
member.summary: This timestamp represented as DateTime ticks, UTC.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.DateTime
member.summary: Returns a DateTime representation of this timestamp, corresponding to the local time of the system. Creates a new DateTime, so careful with that GC, Eugene.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.DateTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns a DateTime representation of this timestamp, as UTC time. Creates a new DateTime, so careful with that GC, Eugene.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp out of the provided DateTime.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp using DateTime or TimeSpan ticks. Ticks need to be UTC in order to produce right results.
member.param: UTC-based tick value.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp out of an NTP-format timestamp.
member.param: An ulong containing NTP timestamp (seconds in the first 32 bits, fraction in the following 32 bits)

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.ToString
member.summary: Returns timestamp as string (in a "day/month/year hours:minutes:seconds:milliseconds format)
